document_data.caption: Copper pieces
document_data.name: Copper
document_data.mainbody: '''Copper''' was a common, precious pure metal used in [[Faerûn]] as the least-valued form of currency in most economies.
document_data.Description: In its natural form, copper had a distinct pink sheen. It was quite soft and famously easy to work in a forge. It had the same weight as [[steel]].
document_data.Worth: Most coins in Faerûn worked off of the [[silver]] and [[gold]] standard, with copper pieces (cp) being worth  1/100th of a gold piece (gp) and silver pieces (sp) being worth 1/10 of a GP. [[Electrum]] coins were worth 50 cp (1/2 gp), and [[platinum]] coins were worth between 500cp (5gp) and 1,000cp (10gp).

Applications.Mundane Items:
* [[Azer]] were often known to wear [[apron]]-like garments made from beaten copper.
* Some [[Calishite lamp]]s were known to be constructed from copper.
* Copper was one of three metals that [[Hurricane lamp]]s were known to be constructed with.
* Copper was one of three metals that the spinning tops of [[Amn]] were known to be constructed with.
* [[Wargong]]s in [[Shou Lung]] were typically constructed of copper.
Applications.Magic Items:
* In the land of [[Zakhara]] there were known to be [[Copper automaton|automatons]] constructed almost entirely of copper.
* The pages of the spellbooks ''[[Tidings of Conflict and Woe]]'' and ''[[Shandaril's Workbook]]'' were both made from copper plates.
* ''[[Magic match]]es'' were typically constructed of copper.
* ''[[One-way lantern]]s'' were typically constructed of copper.
Applications.Currency:
* Copper coins came in a wide variety of sizes and shapes. In [[Waterdeep]] they were known as ''nibs'' and in [[Cormyr]] they were called ''thumbs''.
* In the [[Lands of Intrigue]] copper coins were known as ''unarche'' in [[Calimport]], ''rada'' in [[Almraiven]], and ''spanner'' in [[Manshaka]].
